content.p: Use this graph to answer the questions below.

image.alt: y axis - Blood pressure (mm Hg). Line graph: top line labeled 1, middle line labeled 2, bottom line labeled 3. x axis - from left to right: Aorta, Arteries, Arterioles, Capillaries, Venules, Veins, Venae cavae

question.body: Which of the following represents mean pressure?

response.feedback: Correct. Mean pressure must fall between systolic and diastolic pressures.

question.body: In which vessel(s) is/are the pressure exerted on the vessel wall the greatest.

response.feedback: Correct. Blood pressure is the pressure exerted on the vessel wall, and it is the greatest here.
Incorrect. Blood pressure is the pressure exerted on the vessel wall, and it is not highest in the arterioles.
Incorrect. Blood pressure is the pressure exerted on the vessel wall, and it is not the highest in the capillaries.
Incorrect. Blood pressure is the pressure exerted on the vessel wall, and it is not the highest in the venae cavae.
